translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Alms
I lived in a leaf hut;
Having built a hut in the forest,
I was of good conduct at that time.
Digging up kalambā plants,🔽and biḷālitakkalā plants,
I brought them and prepared them.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the god of gods, the bull of men,
I poured it into his bowl.
Having eaten it all, the all-knowing one,🔽spoke this verse:
you will not go to a bad destination.’
in the Dispensation of the Buddha.
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā biḷālidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Biḷālidāyakattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā biḷālidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽biḷālidāyaka therassa apadānam navama
translated: Thus have I heard: this was said by the Elder Biḷāradvārika.🔽The Story of the Elder Biḷāradvārika is the ninth.
